de.systemagmbh.interfaces.logger
Interface ISysLogWriter

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysLogWriter, DummyISysLogWriter
public interface ISysLogWriter
extends ISysComponent

Let's give a definition of a 'log writer' first:
The 'log writer' is the instance of the logger, that writes a given text. The destination is defined by the implementation. This can be the console, a file, ...
The ISysLogWriter is the interface, that has to be implemented to get a special log output. It defines the method writeLog. This method is executing the writing.
The init method is loading information about the writing (like the name of the log file that has to be written).

Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Torsten Knauft

Method Detail

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws ASysException
Call this method to configure the log writer from a section in the configuration.

Parameters:
configItem - The item in the configuration that contains the writer data.
Throws:
ASysException - if the items needed by the implementation are not available in the configuration.

writeLog

public void writeLog(String logText)
This method will perform the log of the given text.
The text will not be checked or formatted when this method is called.

Parameters:
logText - The text that has to be logged.

close

public void close()
Close the logger.
